TextBody:
Hi Ismail,

We have received some insights from the R&D team regarding this ticket, and we need to schedule another remote session to test and collect extended logs if necessary.

Could you please let us know your availability for a remote session this week?

Thank you!
Best Regards,
Iosif Muntean| Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
 www.endpointprotector.com 


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 2/18/2025 5:50 PM
To: ismail.reyhanoglu@datavisor.com
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #435639 - - Denylist with Content Aware Policy goes wrong [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Lnv1A:ref ]

Hi Ismail,

I have attached the Jamf and Intune deployment guides also here: 
- JAMF: https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EndpointProtector_5.9.4/page/Content/EndpointProtector/Install/Agent/JAMF/Overview.htm
- Microsoft Intune: https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EndpointProtector_5.9.4/page/Content/EndpointProtector/Install/Agent/Intune/Overview.htm

If these guides didn't help you fix the deployment issue(the server IP not being set properly), please raise a separate support ticket, so we can track different issues individually.

Thank you!

Best Regards,
Iosif Muntean| Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
 www.endpointprotector.com 


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Ismail Reyhanoglu [ismail.reyhanoglu@datavisor.com]
Sent: 2/18/2025 10:04 AM
To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #435639 - - Denylist with Content Aware Policy goes wrong [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Lnv1A:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000Lnv1A:ref
 
Hi Iosif,
 

Also, last time we spoke, I mentioned how we are trying to push the Netwrix EPP agent for our employees through Hexnode. I mentioned we are able to install the agent on a device, but they do not pop up on EPP Console, I don't see their device. You mentioned I press: Command + Option + I, on the settings tab and I see 10.10.16.145:443. I asked the guy that his is not working right, and his shows NOT SET (attached in screen shot). I was wondering if you could help me troubleshoot this issue. I am free from 10:30am-12pm PST today Tuesday, February 18th. I am also free from 1pm PST and afterwards. On Wednesday, I am free anytime.

Regards,

Ismail Reyhanoglu

 


On Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 11:28 AM Ismail Reyhanoglu <ismail.reyhanoglu@datavisor.com> wrote:


Thank you for your help!

 

On Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 9:47 AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Ismail,

Thank you for the provided logs.

As discussed, I have raised an internal ticket(reference number 00436075) for our R&D team to investigate, and we will get back to you as soon as we receive any update on this.



Best Regards,
Iosif Muntean| Technical Support Engineer

 www.endpointprotector.com

Iosif is out of office today but will return on Monday and get back to you.
Until then, we cannot state a specific time for engineering to reply as it is based on priorities and the backlog. Rest assured that once we have an update we will let you know.

Thank you,
Eduard Nut

I wanted to follow up on how long I should expect to wait until I hear back from sending over the logs, so we can have another meeting to try to fix the issue. Thanks,

Regards,

Ismail Reyhanoglu

 


On Wed, Feb 12, 2025 at 2:01?PM Ismail Reyhanoglu <ismail.reyhanoglu@datavisor.com> wrote:





Here you go. When I turned on the content aware policy, zoom sign in did not work right away. Gmail does, but after a few minutes, it went down too. Google search worked after Gmail went down, but a few minutes later, it went down too. After I turned off the VPN and captured the logs, my internet doesn't load anymore so I restart my Macbook. Thank you for the help!



 


On Wed, Feb 12, 2025 at 1:37?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Ismail, 

Thank you for the remote session.

Here is a summary of what we did in today's meeting:
- we have enabled the Smart DPI logging for your Mac -> Gmail started working
- after a reboot all the websites were blocked, even the Zoom app

Please use the following steps to collect the logs:

1. Open the terminal
2. use the following commands to create the log files:

	sudo /bin/launchctl unload /Library/LaunchDaemons/com.cososys.eppclient.launchdaemon.plist
	sudo touch /private/var/log/eppclient.log
	sudo touch /private/var/log/eppsslsplit.log
	sudo /bin/launchctl load /Library/LaunchDaemons/com.cososys.eppclient.launchdaemon.plist

3. Reproduce the issue
4. After the issue is reproduced, copy the log files to the Desktop using the commands:

	cp /private/var/log/eppclient.log ~/Desktop
	cp /private/var/log/eppsslsplit.log ~/Desktop
	cp /etc/epp/reprovision.db ~/Desktop
	cp /etc/epp/rights.s3db ~/Desktop
	cp /etc/epp/netdlp/netdlp_settings.json ~/Desktop

5. Sent us the files (attach them to this ticket)

For the MDM solutions we have the following guides:
- JAMF: https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EndpointProtector_5.9.4/page/Content/EndpointProtector/Install/Agent/JAMF/Overview.htm
- Microsoft Intune: https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EndpointProtector_5.9.4/page/Content/EndpointProtector/Install/Agent/Intune/Overview.htm


Best Regards,
Iosif Muntean| Technical Support Engineer

 www.endpointprotector.com

On Wed, Feb 12, 2025 at 9:34?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Ismail,

Thank you for reaching out.

Please enable the Intercept VPN Traffic from Device Control -> Global Settings, following the steps from the documentation: 
https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EndpointProtector_5.9.4/page/Content/EndpointProtector/Admin/DeviceControl/GlobalSettings.htm#intercept_vpn_trac

Please let us know if this solves your issue.

Best Regards,
Iosif Muntean| Technical Support Engineer

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000Lnv1A:ref

I solved this, u can close this ticket. The only thing i noticed is if the
user isnt connected to vpn which connects to EPP server, once or twice the
denylist stops applying even tho it was received from a previous policy
from last time it was connected, and i thought the latest policy recieved
supposed to remain even if it loses connection. it worked again once i
reconnected. but besides that, it has been working smooth

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000Lnv1A:ref
 
I solved this, u can close this ticket. The only thing i noticed is if the user isnt connected to vpn which connects to EPP server, once or twice the denylist stops applying even tho it was received from a previous policy from last time it was connected, and i thought the latest policy recieved supposed to remain even if it loses connection. it worked again once i reconnected. but besides that, it has been working smooth

Here you go. When I turned on the content aware policy, zoom sign in did not work right away. Gmail does, but after a few minutes, it went down too. Google search worked after Gmail went down, but a few minutes later, it went down too. After I turned off the VPN and captured the logs, my internet doesn't load anymore so I restart my Macbook. Thank you for the help!



 


On Wed, Feb 12, 2025 at 1:37?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Ismail, 

Thank you for the remote session.

Here is a summary of what we did in today's meeting:
- we have enabled the Smart DPI logging for your Mac -> Gmail started working
- after a reboot all the websites were blocked, even the Zoom app

Please use the following steps to collect the logs:

1. Open the terminal
2. use the following commands to create the log files:

	sudo /bin/launchctl unload /Library/LaunchDaemons/com.cososys.eppclient.launchdaemon.plist
	sudo touch /private/var/log/eppclient.log
	sudo touch /private/var/log/eppsslsplit.log
	sudo /bin/launchctl load /Library/LaunchDaemons/com.cososys.eppclient.launchdaemon.plist

3. Reproduce the issue
4. After the issue is reproduced, copy the log files to the Desktop using the commands:

	cp /private/var/log/eppclient.log ~/Desktop
	cp /private/var/log/eppsslsplit.log ~/Desktop
	cp /etc/epp/reprovision.db ~/Desktop
	cp /etc/epp/rights.s3db ~/Desktop
	cp /etc/epp/netdlp/netdlp_settings.json ~/Desktop

5. Sent us the files (attach them to this ticket)

For the MDM solutions we have the following guides:
- JAMF: https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EndpointProtector_5.9.4/page/Content/EndpointProtector/Install/Agent/JAMF/Overview.htm
- Microsoft Intune: https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EndpointProtector_5.9.4/page/Content/EndpointProtector/Install/Agent/Intune/Overview.htm


Best Regards,
Iosif Muntean| Technical Support Engineer
